head.title: Tufts University President Is to Retire

hedline.hl1: Tufts University President Is to Retire

abstract.p: John DiBiaggio will retire as president of Tufts University (S)

block.p: John DiBiaggio, a Detroit-born dentist who has helped promote public service in higher education, yesterday announced his plans to retire as president of Tufts University in Medford, Mass.

Dr. DiBiaggio, 68, has presided over the 8,500-student campus since 1992, and plans to remain until a successor is selected, or until June 2002. He previously served as president of Michigan State University and the University of Connecticut.
John DiBiaggio, a Detroit-born dentist who has helped promote public service in higher education, yesterday announced his plans to retire as president of Tufts University in Medford, Mass.

Dr. DiBiaggio, 68, has presided over the 8,500-student campus since 1992, and plans to remain until a successor is selected, or until June 2002. He previously served as president of Michigan State University and the University of Connecticut.

During Dr. DiBiaggio's tenure, Tufts' endowment more than tripled, to $600 million from $180 million. Among the new initiatives is the College of Citizenship and Public Service, a university-wide push to integrate those values as core elements of the curriculum funded by a $10 million donation from Pierre Omidyar, the founder of eBay.
